title: Lenovo OKR8 One Key Recovery 8 Engineer ISO
description:
Screen shot: http://bayimg.com/cAPmOaAfK


Lenovo's proprietary One-Key-Recovery boot disk.


For all Idea Laptops installed with Microsoft  Windows 8 and Lenovo OneKey Recovery 8.0.

What it does:

Re-partitions and formats hard-drive to lenovos standard. 


Why you need it:

You changed your partition size and now OKR no longer works.

You accidentally / purposely  whipped out your partitions and lost OKR.

You do computer repair.


How to: ( !! for users that got a new hard-drive or for users that completely whipped out their hard-drive without backing up their recovery image !!)


Download the .iso

Use ISO2DISK to burn image to DVD or USB http://www.top-password.com/iso2disc.html
Screenshot: http://bayimg.com/eApMhAAfK

Boot from DVD/USB (might need to play with bios settings UEFI/Legacy/Secure Boot)if your USB doesn't show up in boot menu.

The language is in Chinese (anyone know how to change to english?) 
- just click the check box and click on the only button.

*THIS WILL WIPE OUT ALL DATA ON HD*

Wait for all done pop up window.

Shutdown laptop.

Turn on laptop by pressing NOVO button

Select Sytem Recovery

If it boots up to OKR then your good. If you already have a backup image on another drive, you can restore from it now.

INSTALLING FRESH COPY OF WINDOWS 8.1 Instructions:

Now that you have your lenovo partitions all set up, its time to install Win8.1.

I tried using an older Windows 8.1 copy I had but it kept erroring out during install  with error 0000005. If you get that error, it most likely means your source disk is bad or your hardware is bad.

I downloaded a more recent copy by MURPHY78 (http://thepiratebay.se/torrent/10567314/Windows_8.1_AIO_24in1_with_Update_x64_en-US_Jul2014) and it installed perfectly.

When installing windows, chose the partition Windows8_OS.

When done, google your lenovo model drivers. Make sure you install One-key-recovery software/drivers. When you are done installing all your drivers and software, run the One-key-recovery program and make a system backup. 

OPTIONAL: When done backing up, its important for you to make an offline backup copy of your newly created backup.
D:LenovoOneKeyAppOneKey Recovery
- Just back up the whole folder (compress and copy to backup hard-drive)
- You will need to enable 'show hidden files' in order to access folder.
With that backed up, you can do what you want with your laptop and then just boot up the ORK Iso and point it at your external HD backed up recovery folder.

Note: To change OKR language from English:

After burning to USB, open with notepad:

okr8LRS_ESPOneKeyMAINLRS-Config-Org.xml
and
okr8LRS_ESPOneKeyMAINLRS-Config.xml

Change en-us to your language code and save.

 I created this torrent after a week of troubleshooting my Yoga 2 11 - I hope you find it helpful. I will try to respond to questions. Good luck.
